reviews.review_msg: The emphasis on the group project was too much. It felt like he was looking for a few things from each group and you would be dinged if you did not focus on them in your project and paper. I really enjoyed the course material from his assigned regular readings but the city studio project just gave this course an overall vague feeling.

Professor Kenny is a really nice person and his lectures are pretty good, but the way he taught this course left me rather disappointed. The heavy emphasis on a group project (in collaboration with citystudio) overshadowed the rest of the course material, and though the project was alright, in the end I felt like I learned very little.

Ok, so I didn't get a great mark in this class (B-), but this is not really a reflection of him as a prof. I was just not interested in the material. Not his fault. This makes me qualified to rate him. He is passionate about this subject clearly. He is also understanding. He marks really hard, IMO, but he challenges you to do better.
I feel like Prof. Kenny doesn't deserve such a low rating. Overall he is a fair marker and makes some funny jokes. As long as you try and put in the effort you can do well.
Super nice guy. Don't listen to all these bad reviews he's a fair marker and a funky dude. I would take a class with him again in a heart beat.

Nice guy and he tries to make it a good class. The reality is that for all of his strengths, teaching  is not one of them. That said you can still succeed in the class especially if you write a good essay. It's not a walk in the park but that does not mean you should avoid taking classes with him. Mixes it up with field trips.
